thread.title: Manchester City believe Gabriel Jesus will help make Sergio Aguero BETTER rather than replace him
thread.title_full: Manchester City believe Gabriel Jesus will help make Sergio Aguero BETTER rather than replace him

author: David McDonnell
title: Manchester City believe Gabriel Jesus will help make Sergio Aguero BETTER rather than replace him
text:
Sport Manchester City believe Gabriel Jesus will help make Sergio Aguero BETTER rather than replace him The Argentine has seen his future at the Etihad brought into question after seeing Brazil striker Gabriel make an outstanding start to life in England Share The Brazilian now looks to be Guardiola's No.1 pick up front (Photo: AFP/Getty Images)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Sergio Aguero will benefit from being dropped for Gabriel Jesus, according to those in charge at Manchester City. 
Aguero was benched for the second game in a row on Sunday for Brazilian wonderkid Jesus, who scored both goals in City’s last-gasp 2-1 win over Swansea. 
After the win, Aguero, who has been City’s first-choice striker since he joined from Atletico Madrid for £38million in 2011, said he did not know if he had a future at the Etihad Stadium. 
City officials moved quickly to insist there is no way they will be willing to sell Aguero - who is under contract until 2020 - this summer, despite Real Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain ready to swoop for his signature. 
The City hierarchy believe the signing of 19-year-old sensation Jesus will ultimately turn out to be a good thing for Aguero, providing the striker with some much-needed competition. Aguero was just a substitute against Swansea (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) While Gabriel proved to be the match-winner (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
Aguero’s No.1 status has been unchallenged during his five-and-a-half years at City until now, with the hope the arrival of Jesus can help the 28-year-old take his game to an even higher level. 
City boss Pep Guardiola demands a huge work ethic from his players, running off the ball and tracking back, something he has praised Jesus for in his first few games for the club. 
Aguero does less of that work off the ball and Guardiola hopes he can learn from his younger rival to ensure he can fit into his football philosophy. The suggestion is Aguero needs to do more off the ball (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Although Guardiola has insisted Aguero remains a key part of his plans and the player himself says he wants to stay, much will depend on what happens between now and the end of the season. 
Guardiola has dropped Aguero several times already this season and it is likely he will have to get used to the bench, with the City boss in no mood to rest Jesus on current form. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
